name: Swedenborgian Visions
description: Explore Emanuel Swedenborg's claimed direct experiences of the afterlife, detailing the soul's awakening in the world of spirits, the revelation of inner nature, and the self-chosen societies of heaven and hell.

lessons.title: Swedenborgian Visions: Direct Experience
lessons.content: Emanuel Swedenborg claimed direct experience of the afterlife through spiritual sight, describing a world even more vivid than earth. At death, angels attend the dying, ensuring a peaceful transition. The soul then awakens in the 'world of spirits'—an intermediate realm between heaven and hell. Here, external facades drop away, revealing the soul's true inner nature. [cite: 678, 679, 680]

questions.question: Who claimed direct experience of the afterlife through spiritual sight?
questions.explanation: Emanuel Swedenborg claimed direct experience of the afterlife through spiritual sight. [cite: 678]

questions.question: The 'world of spirits' is the final destination for all souls.
questions.explanation: The 'world of spirits' is an intermediate realm between heaven and hell. [cite: 680]

lessons.title: The First State: Earthly Resemblance
lessons.content: This first state in the world of spirits closely resembles earthly life. Spirits meet deceased friends and relatives and explore familiar-seeming landscapes. Gradually, they come to realize they have died. Notably, some spirits, especially materialists who denied the existence of an afterlife, may initially refuse to believe they have died. This reflects the impact of earthly beliefs on immediate post-mortem experiences. [cite: 681, 682]

questions.question: What characterizes the first state in the world of spirits?
questions.explanation: This first state resembles earthly life. [cite: 681]

questions.question: All spirits immediately accept they have died in the world of spirits.
questions.explanation: Some refuse to believe it, especially materialists who denied afterlife existence. [cite: 682]

lessons.title: The Second State and Natural Sorting
lessons.content: The second state strips away all pretense. Secret thoughts become visible, and hidden desires manifest. This process creates a natural sorting: those who love goodness and truth gravitate toward heaven, while those preferring selfishness and falsity drift toward hell. This sorting is a consequence of their deepest affections and inner states, rather than an external judgment. [cite: 683, 684]

questions.question: What happens in the second state of the afterlife?
options: Secret thoughts and hidden desires manifest
Souls merge into a collective consciousness
questions.correctAnswer: Secret thoughts and hidden desires manifest
questions.explanation: The second state strips away all pretense. Secret thoughts become visible, hidden desires manifest. [cite: 683]

questions.question: The sorting into heaven or hell is arbitrary.
questions.explanation: This creates natural sorting—those who love goodness and truth gravitate toward heaven, while those preferring selfishness and falsity drift toward hell. [cite: 684]

lessons.title: Heaven and Hell: Societies of Choice
lessons.content: Heaven in Swedenborg's vision arranges into countless societies based on mutual love and use. Each society manifests as a beautiful landscape reflecting its inhabitants' states. Angels engage in meaningful work, study, and relationships, experiencing ever-deepening joy and wisdom. Hell likewise contains societies, but these are based on mutual hatred and evil. Inhabitants choose hell, finding heavenly light and warmth unbearable, preferring their darkness, even though it brings continual conflict and suffering. Swedenborg emphasized that God condemns no one; each soul gravitates to its proper place through free choice, finding the environment matching its deepest loves. [cite: 685, 686, 687, 688, 689, 690]

questions.question: What is the basis for societies in Heaven?
questions.explanation: Heaven arranges in countless societies based on mutual love and use. [cite: 685]

questions.question: God directly condemns souls to hell in Swedenborgian belief.
questions.explanation: Swedenborg emphasized that God condemns no one. Each soul gravitates to its proper place through free choice. [cite: 690]

questions.question: Why do inhabitants of hell prefer their darkness?
options: They find heavenly light and warmth unbearable
It allows them to plot evil
It is where they can find peace
questions.correctAnswer: They find heavenly light and warmth unbearable
questions.explanation: They prefer their darkness, though it brings continual conflict and suffering—not imposed punishment but natural consequence of their chosen states. [cite: 689]

questions.question: What happens to external facades in the 'world of spirits'?
options: They drop away, revealing true inner nature
questions.correctAnswer: They drop away, revealing true inner nature
questions.explanation: Here, external facades drop away, revealing true inner nature. [cite: 680]

questions.question: Swedenborgian hell is a place of imposed punishment by God.
questions.explanation: Swedenborg emphasized that God condemns no one... suffering—not imposed punishment but natural consequence of their chosen states. [cite: 690]

questions.question: Who assists the dying in their peaceful transition in Swedenborgian belief?
questions.explanation: At death, angels attend the dying, ensuring peaceful transition. [cite: 679]
